description.narrative:
PAG:Project Title: WASH and Protection humanitarian response in Ofua Zone of Rhino Camp-Arua district.
This project intends to continue supporting South Sudan refugees and the hosting communities in Rhino camp settlement through WASH activities (sanitation, hygiene and shelter) distribution of sanitary kits to school girls and women with special needs still undergo monthly menstrual periods for the next 3 months starting from April 2017 to June 2017. The project will be a follow-up of the WASH projectthat was successfully implemented by PAG during December 2016 to January 2017 with funding from OXFAM. Construction of pit latrines in schools using government standard designs will assure and promote privacy for the opposite sexes (girls and boys) and it will contribute to reductionin disease incidences resulting from poor faecal disposal. Working in close collaboration with the local government will create a sense of ownership because the infrastructures will revert back to the district local government when the refugees return home and this will reduce government burden to manage emergency occurrences.
Construction of houses for PSNs shall improve the quality of lifeof the PSNs. They will have better shelters and sanitation facilities thereby reducing incidences of hygiene related illnesses
Provision of core relief items and hand washing facilities will enable female sex experiencing menstrual monthly cycle to maintain goodmenstrual hygiene and management. It will contribute to increase enrollment and retention and good class attendance by school girlshence reducing school drop outs resulting from failures to manage menstrual hygiene and management
Hygiene education in schools and at HH level will improve the level of participation of beneficiaries in sanitation activities e.g. washing hands after using latrine, cleaning the pit latrines on a daily basis, constructing dish racks, using 1 refuse pit per HH, 2 refuse pits per school and 1 hygiene promoter per 500 persons will improve hygiene and sanitation situation and reducing incidences of disease spread in the settlement at both institutional, community and household levels. This is further expected to decrease the risk of outbreaks of diseases like cholera hence improve general healthand living conditions of refugees and hosting communities.
Psychosocial interventions shall create peaceful co-existence between the conflicting groups. These avenues shall build resilience among the depressed communities and individuals.
Promotionofcash transfer programming will increase access to income to most household members that will boost the family financial status and enabling them to meet basic domestic needs instead of staying idle.
The project envisages transformed, healthier and happy refugee and host families free from post war trauma and co-existing peaceful with all. The project targets to concentrate in only zone of the Camp with a total population of 43,178 people.More focus will be on schools and young girls.

participating-org.narrative:
The Pentecostal Assemblies of God is a Church based Organization, supporting humanitarian work through its Social Development Services Department. It was registered with the government of Uganda as a corporate body in 1966, followed by NGO registration in 1991 under the 1989 Non-Governmental Organizations Registration Statute. PAG Social Development work was formally established in 1992 and has since been going on in over 8 Districts. With a mission To engage communities in holistic development that transforms their lives in desired dignity through participatory poverty reduction and Christian Ministry
PAG is overseen by the National Executive Committee composed of the General Superintendent, the General Secretary and an array of Bishops countrywide,who are the senior pastors ofthe fellowship and are elected during the General and district Conferences of the PAG Fellowship. The National Development Services(NDS) is an arm of PAG responsible for social development work. It#s headed by the Country Director, who reports to the National Board of Directors. The National Development Services has eleven (11) field development offices in the different locations (pastorates) across the country.
Institutional objectives: 1. Capacity and Institutional Strengthening for effective and efficient service delivery 2. Holistic Human Development of PAG catchment 3. Promotion of sustainable livelihoods 4. Lobbying and Advocacy through networks and collaboration to influence pro-poor policy reforms.
Field(s)of activity:? # Livelihoods (Karamoja region) # HIV-AIDS (Teso) # Disaster Risk Reduction (countrywide) # Emergency Response (countrywide)
PAG SDS is unique in that it has branches all over the country that have a strong influence within the communities and this works as entry points to the communities. In addition PAG has a diversity of professionals within the church which provides for a rich experience that can support church social development programmes.
